lesson: Check for 'Utilization Hours' exceeding theoretical physical limits (e.g. >24h/day or >12h/day for PV without explanations).
Sum of sub-items must equal the total. Floating point errors should be within negligible tolerance (e.g., 0.1).
Development must not be at the expense of human life. Safety is the prerequisite for all work.
When project schedules, business indicators, or performance assessments conflict with safety, strict adherence to 'Safety First' is required.
Implement a risk management mechanism of 'Annual Report, Monthly Plan, Weekly Adjustment, Daily Implementation'.
Do not suspend Time-of-Use (TOU) pricing mechanisms or narrow their scope without authorization. Avoid disguised electricity price discounts.
For mid-to-long term contracts, peak-valley price differences should not be lower than the catalog TOU price difference.
